data.title: A Wonderful Experience Any Time
data.text: This is such a great place to stroll through any time. There is so much to see. Plus the annual events are a real treat! Sounds Exciting Summer Concerts, Cider Days, Lakewood Lights and more. What a wonderful place. I hope you get a chance to explore it.

data.title: A little walking history
data.text: The Lakewood Heritage Center is like a little walking history. Part of a beautiful park near Belmar, you can walk along a virtual Colfax Avenue, like you would walk down "memory lane".  There is also a small museum, and if you select your visit's date right, you can visit at a time when there are guided tours, and other fun activities.

data.title: Wonderful 20th Century Museum
data.text: You can see lots of 19th century and mining museums in Colorado, but NOT a 20th century museum.  There are several buildings on the property, majority brought in and restored.  They offer tours twice at day at 11 and 2 so you can see the inside of the buildings.  I suggest going during a special event like Cider Days where you can get in to the buildings with price of admission.

data.title: Reminded me of the movie 'Cars'
data.text:
I walked from my hotel to Belmar Park area, looking for this centre in particular. It is such a lovely location, especially near the lake where you can see huge birds nests high in the trees on a little island. 

What was awesome is that many of the buildings in the outdoors centre are re-located houses, shops and even an old motel sign. I felt on a movie backlot.

data.title: Beautiful Venue
data.text: You can enjoy the park setting, go to the gift shop (really imaginative, not the typical stuff) and even a show. Don't miss the wonderful Holiday Sale in Nov or early Dec.

data.title: Great Place to Visit
data.text: The Lakewood Heritage Center is a 20th century museum located  in the Belmar area. There are a variety of historic structures including the Valentine Diner and the 20th century schoolhouse. The 20th Century Emporium, a museum store offers interesting collectables and gift items featuring products popular from the 1940's through the 1980's. In addition, there is a summer concert series at the outdoor amphitheater where you can bring a picnic dinner and sit on a blanket on the beautiful lawn and enjoy wonderful music. I have personally enjoyed a picnic dinner while listening to the music at the amphitheater as well as the 20th century museum exhibits and emporium. A fun place to visit!

data.title: summer concert series
data.text: every summer they have 6 to 8 outdoor concerts. great acoustics and beautiful surroundings and sunsets. lots of other fun things going on all year, check the website

data.title: the lakewood surprise
data.text: We sort of stumbled onto this wonderful center; taking advantage of the wonderful walking trails and paths behind the Bel Mar Library, we were on a walk after visiting the library, and wandered over to check out the unusual buildings nestled down in the pleasant little valley, we were surprised to see such a comprehensive museum of early days in Lakewood.  There's also old farm buildings and machinery, and even a couple wonderful old houses.  We'll take more walks around the area again, and we  hope to return fora  summer concert.

data.title: An historic village
data.text: Lakewood has taken the initiative to acquire and restore early buildings from the area.  The collections of builidings are both business and homes.  this is an interesting colllection.

data.title: Not exactly a thrill ride but interesting enough--and good meeting space
data.text: Roaming through the Lakewood Heritage Center makes for an interesting afternoon stroll but it would be so much more fun if you could actually go into more of the buildings that are there. The facades hold so much promise, but then, the facade is all you get. That said, they have some unique meeting spaces there, from the modernist chrome/silver building to the traditional old schoolhouse. These spaces could be perfect for the right group, and as a backdrop to your meeting location, even the empty facades offer more to explore than you will every find at an average hotel.

data.title: Fun find in a walking park
data.text: Loved the original old buildings and walking trails.  It's a dog friendly park with a small pond in the middle.  Great for history buffs that would like to know more about the area.

data.title: A small attraction...
data.text:
The Lakewood Heritage Center is a shiny new building that celebrates the 20th century.  The interior while open and spacious only contains two rooms of exhibits, one changing and one that is focused on the development of Lakewood and the park that the Center is located in.  Effort is given to make the exhibits kid friendly.  There is always something to touch or try on or play with.  The gift shop in the Center is really a treat with old fashioned twentieth century treats- Etchasketches and old cruiser bikes compete with fun cards and martini glasses.  There are old machines and classic buildings to view outdoors.  The Center is located in a very nice park with ample walking and bird watching opportunities.  Some folks might skate, bike, or run instead.
    The Center is free unless you choose to pay for a guided tour.

data.title: A must see for history buffs!!!
data.text: This place rocks!!! They have some of the actual buildings that were part of the beginnings of Lakewood.  That is a school building, a home of one of the pioneers of Lakewood,  a cattle auction buiding, and a lot more. Learn a little history through a first hand point of view while enjoying the magnificent grounds!!!

data.title: Love the out door shows
data.text: I have enjoyed going with friends to the out door music programs the last several years. The are on Wednesday nights on the lawn and are in expensive entertainment. You can bring a picnic to enjoy. They prohibit bringing alcohol but have beer and wine for sale.

data.title: Belmar Park is wonderful
data.text: This is where my husband proposed (on the bridge) but all of Belmar Park is wonderful to visit. If you go during Cider Days, you won't be sorry but just a walk around the lake is very relaxing and to see the wildlife in the lake is wonderful.

data.title: Great park
data.text: A variety of experiences from Concerts in the Park to Apple Cider Days. Truly enjoy going and watching the tractor pulls and watching the kiddies make apple juice for their cider. The heritage center has some really great displays and change frequently enough to keep you interested.

data.title: If you like history, you'll love this place
data.text: This heritage center is more than a museum, and a stage.  It has actual period buildings with actual equipment and vehicles in an actual depiction of how life once was in the area.  Much of it is outdoors, hands on, and very informative.  It is also easily located right off a main road, inexpensive, and near a variety of shopping and restaurants.  It is a must see for anyone visiting the area, and interested in its history.

data.title: Lakewood Heritage Center
data.text: This is a great cultural center with exceptionally well-done plays.  We have enjoyed seeing many great musicals here.

data.title: Nice open space park with weekly concerts in the summer.
data.text: This park has a great location near my new condo at Belmar, i.e., it is within walking distance and more important, you can avoid Wadsworth heavy traffic by accessing the underground tunnel below the roadway. This leads to the park. The park itself has a museum and historical buildings from Denver and Lakewood's past, with a few Art Deco type buildings that have been restored. The museum is free, with a suggested donation. I found it to be outstanding and it only takes about 45 minutes to tour the entire building. The open space park hike is approximately a couple of miles in length. You will pass streams and lakes, as well as the concert area and library. Occasionally, you will see horses being ridden here as well. Not too far from this park is the civic center, where you can participate in classes and also view community theater. The police department is also located near hear. This is an excellent place to take the family, go running, walk, read a book, have a picnic, view a concert, or just relax and feed the ducks. I would strongly recommend this park.

data.title: Great Night
data.text: I took my two sons (12 & 10) to a concert here.  It is a very nice facility.  There is free ample parking, you can bring in chairs, and a cooler.  They also have food trucks there selling various foods.  the prices are reasonable and it is a nice evening out under the stars.
